description: This dense, chewy, and satisfying no yeast bread rises with baking soda and buttermilk.
ingredients: [{"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": 4.25}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "baking soda", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": 4}, {"name": "honey", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "buttermilk", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.75}, {"name": "whole oats", "units": "Tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "coarse sea salt", "units": null, "amount": null}]
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. 2. Whisk the flour, salt, and baking soda together in a large bowl. 3. Whisk the melted butter and honey together. Pour into the flour mixture and toss to combine. 4. In 2-3 additions, pour in the buttermilk mixing for 15-20 seconds after each addition. 5. Pour the shaggy dough onto a lightly floured work surface. Shape into a ball and flatten into a disc. 6. Transfer to the prepared skillet/pan. Brush with buttermilk and score the top with an X. 7. Bake until golden brown, about 45 minutes. 8. Allow to cool before slicing.
notes: Buttermilk is key to the bread’s flavor, texture, and rise. If you don’t have buttermilk, you can make a homemade substitute.
tags: bread, no yeast, quick bread, soda bread
